args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (a practice, artifact, or behavior) serves as an expression or manifestation of the object (a belief, value, or attitude).
args.justification: All three relations describe ancient Egyptian burial practices serving as an expression or manifestation of underlying beliefs or reverence; they share the same predicate semantics (practices expressing cultural/ religious concepts) and differ only in wording such as 'reflects' vs 'expresses' vs 'manifest'.

These links connect cultural practices to the beliefs or values they express, forming a coherent family of relations where practices function as expressions of underlying cultural or religious concepts.

The semantics are about representation/manifestation (burial practices representing or expressing beliefs and reverence), not composition, causality, or hierarchy; a broad group focused on representational relations is most appropriate.

These links connect cultural practices to the beliefs or values they express, forming a coherent family of relations where practices function as expressions of underlying cultural or religious concepts.

The semantics are about representation/manifestation (burial practices representing or expressing beliefs and reverence), not composition, causality, or hierarchy; a broad group focused on representational relations is most appropriate.
